page.title: 02HISTORY: Almondbury and area
page.content: {Almondbury}is the most historic place in our survey area. It is referred to in the lO86 survey as Alemanberie. A charter was obtained in l294 for a market in woollen cloth. Buildings of interest include Wormall Hall (l4OO), Fenay Hall (l6O5), King James's School, and half-timbered buildings. The Lascelles family home, now converted into cottages, dates from the 18th century and gave its name to the village of{Lascelles Hall. {Woodsome Hall}is now the club house of Woodsome Golf Club. The 16th century fabric was enlarged later, and in the 18th century Capability Brown was engaged to improve the layout of Woodsome.{Ravensknowle Hall,}built 1859-62, is now a museum.
